102-11 Precautionary principle [Climate Risk] The precautionary principle states that when there is 
suspected risk of causing harm, protective action should be supported 
before there is complete proof of a risk. Through our precautionary 
approach to environmental sustainability and greenhouse gas emissions 
reduction, we continuously monitor and address the physical risks 
associated with climate change. Our ESG Steering Committee regularly 
examines the regulatory landscape for potential risks that may have an 
impact on business continuity or increase the cost of operations due to 
climate-related issues.
